summary: This is an email from a federal prosecutor to a state attorney regarding scheduling and coordination of Jeffrey Epstein's plea and sentencing. It references a federal non-prosecution agreement and seeks documents to ensure Epstein's compliance, indicating a planned state plea deal that would allow Epstein to begin serving a sentence by January 4, 2008.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case; the email discusses the scheduling of his plea and sentencing, and his obligation to begin serving a sentence under an agreement.

persons.name: Judge McSorley
persons.context: The judge presiding over the state case; the email writer hopes the judge will schedule the plea and sentencing before January 4, 2008.

connections.description: Judge McSorley is the presiding judge over Epstein's state criminal case, responsible for accepting the plea and imposing sentence.

events.title: Case Disposition Conference Set
events.description: The FBI informed the parties that a case disposition conference has been scheduled in the Epstein case for January 2008.

events.title: Originally Contemplated Plea and Sentencing
events.description: The original agreement with Epstein contemplated a simultaneous plea and sentencing for October 2007.

events.title: Revised Plea and Sentencing Date
events.description: The agreement was later revised to schedule the simultaneous plea and sentencing for November 2007.

events.title: Epstein's Scheduled Self-Surrender
events.description: Under the agreement, Epstein was to self-surrender to begin serving his sentence no later than January 4, 2008.

keyFacts: A federal non-prosecution agreement exists between federal authorities and Jeffrey Epstein, which is contingent on his compliance with a state plea deal.
The scheduling of Epstein's state plea and sentencing was being coordinated between federal and state prosecutors to meet the terms of the federal agreement.
The federal prosecutor sought copies of the state plea agreement, the Information, and related documents to monitor Epstein's compliance.
The timeline shows a planned sequence where Epstein would plead guilty and be sentenced in late 2007, then self-surrender to begin his sentence by January 4, 2008.
